an7.38:1.6: Notice the mention of “enduring”, which contradicts the interpretation of experience as consisting of mind moments each of infinitesimally small duration.
an7.38:1.9: In relation to his own mind, not in external, objective terms. What is suitable or unsuitable, good or bad, etc., depends solely on one’s mental state and motivation at the time of the action, not on any objective properties of the action itself (the precepts being already taken for granted).
